channel.title: vimscript on Math2001's blog
channel.description: Recent content in vimscript on Math2001's blog

item.title: Great resources for VIM users
item.description: If you’re a VIM user, have a look at these resources, they’re pretty good (you probably will know some, if not all of them)

item.title: DynamicOpen function
item.description: I really open my .vimrc often. Too often to have to type :e ~/.vimrc or :tabe ~/.vimrc every time. Here’s little function that will open a file in a new tab if there isn’t enough room for a new split, and, you guessed it, in a new vertical split if there is.

item.title: Rerun last command with bang
item.description: Put this code in your vimrc to re run the previous command but with the bang (!) by just typing :Please.

item.title: Variable scopes in vim
item.description: An interesting feature of vim script is variable scoping. Here’s a copy-paste from the documentation, just in case you never saw it before.
